bill.summary:
1/21/2015--Introduced. Northern Border Security Review Act
Directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to submit a northern border threat analysis, which shall include analyses of:
terrorism threats posed by individuals seeking to enter the United States through the northern border; improvements needed at ports of entry along the northern border to prevent terrorists and instruments of terror from entering the United States; gaps in law, policy, international agreements, or tribal agreements that hinder the border security and counterterrorism efforts along the northern border; and illegal cross border activity between ports of entry, including the maritime borders of the Great Lakes.
